   72:          gracefull_invalid_start/1,
   73:          gracefull_invalid_version/1,
   74:          kex_error/1,
   75:          interrupted_send/1,
   76:          max_channels_option/1,
   77:          no_sensitive_leak/1,
   78:          ptty_alloc/1,
   79:          ptty_alloc_default/1,
   80:          ptty_alloc_pixel/1,
   81:          read_write_loop/1,
   82:          read_write_loop1/2,

   98:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun2/1,
   99:          start_shell_exec_direct_fun3/1,
  100:          start_shell_exec_fun/1,

  102:          start_shell_exec_fun3/1,
  103:          start_shell_sock_daemon_exec/1,
  104:          start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi/1,
  105:          start_shell_sock_exec_fun/1,
  106:          start_subsystem_on_closed_channel/1,

  108:          ssh_exec_echo/2 % called as an MFA
  109:         ]).
  110: 
  111: -define(EXEC_TIMEOUT, 10000).
  112: 
  113: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  114: %% Common Test interface functions -----------------------------------
  115: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  116: 
  117: %% suite() ->
  118: %%     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
  119: 
  120: suite() ->
  121:     [{timetrap,{seconds,40}}].
  122: 
  123: all() ->
  124:     [
  125:      {group, openssh},
  126:      small_interrupted_send,
  127:      interrupted_send,
  128:      exec_erlang_term,
  129:      exec_erlang_term_non_default_shell,
  130:      exec_disabled,
  131:      exec_shell_disabled,
  132:      start_shell,
  133:      start_shell_pty,
  134:      start_shell_exec,
  135:      start_shell_exec_fun,
  136:      start_shell_exec_fun2,
  137:      start_shell_exec_fun3,
  138:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun,
  139:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun2,
  140:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun3,
  141:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error,
  142:      start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type,
  143:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write,
  144:      start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced,
  145:      start_shell_sock_exec_fun,
  146:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec,
  147:      start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi,
  148:      encode_decode_pty_opts,
  149:      connect_sock_not_tcp,
  150:      connect2_invalid_options,
  151:      connect_invalid_port,
  152:      connect_invalid_options,
  153:      connect_invalid_timeout_0,
  154:      connect_invalid_timeout_1,
  155:      connect3_invalid_port,
  156:      connect3_invalid_options,
  157:      connect3_invalid_timeout_0,
  158:      connect3_invalid_timeout_1,
  159:      connect3_invalid_both,
  160:      connect4_invalid_two_0,
  161:      connect4_invalid_two_1,
  162:      connect4_invalid_two_2,
  163:      connect4_invalid_three,
  164:      connect_timeout,
  165:      daemon_sock_not_tcp,
  166:      gracefull_invalid_version,
  167:      gracefull_invalid_start,
  168:      gracefull_invalid_long_start,
  169:      gracefull_invalid_long_start_no_nl,
  170:      kex_error,
  171:      stop_listener,
  172:      no_sensitive_leak,
  173:      start_subsystem_on_closed_channel,
  174:      max_channels_option
  175:     ].
  176: groups() ->
  177:     [{openssh, [], payload() ++ ptty() ++ sock()}].
  178: 
  179: payload() ->
  180:     [simple_exec,
  181:      simple_exec_sock,
  182:      simple_exec_two_socks,
  183:      small_cat,
  184:      big_cat,
  185:      send_after_exit].
  186: 
  187: ptty() ->
  188:     [ptty_alloc_default,
  189:      ptty_alloc,
  190:      ptty_alloc_pixel].
  191: 
  192: sock() ->
  193:     [connect_sock_not_passive,
  194:      daemon_sock_not_passive
  195:     ].
  196: 
  197: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  198: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  199:     ?CHECK_CRYPTO(
  200:        [{ptty_supported, ssh_test_lib:ptty_supported()}
  201:         | Config]
  202:       ).
  203: 
  204: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
  205:     catch ssh:stop(),
  206:     ok.
  207: 
  208: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  209: init_per_group(openssh, Config) ->
  210:     case ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []) of
  211: 	{error,econnrefused} ->
  212: 	    {skip,"No openssh daemon (econnrefused)"};
  213: 	{ok, Socket} ->
  214: 	    gen_tcp:close(Socket),
  215: 	    ssh_test_lib:openssh_sanity_check(Config)
  216:     end;
  217: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
  218:     Config.
  219: 
  220: end_per_group(_, Config) ->
  221:     Config.
  222: 
  223: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  224: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
  225:     %% To make sure we start clean as it is not certain that
  226:     %% end_per_testcase will be run!
  227:     end_per_testcase(any, Config),
  228:     ssh:start(),
  229:     Config.
  230: 
  231: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, _Config) ->
  232:     ssh:stop().
  233: 
  234: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  235: %% Test Cases --------------------------------------------------------
  236: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  237: simple_exec(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  238:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  239:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  240: 
  241: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  242: simple_exec_sock(_Config) ->
  243:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  244:     {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  245:                                              {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  246:                                              {user_interaction, true}
  247:                                             ]),
  248:     do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef).
  249: 
  250: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  251: simple_exec_two_socks(_Config) ->
  252:     Parent = self(),
  253:     F = fun() ->
  254:                 spawn_link(
  255:                   fun() ->
  256:                           {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{active,false}]),
  257:                           {ok, ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  258:                                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  259:                                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  260:                           Parent ! {self(),do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef)}
  261:                   end)
  262:         end,
  263:     Pid1 = F(),
  264:     Pid2 = F(),
  265:     receive
  266:         {Pid1,ok} -> ok
  267:     end,
  268:     receive
  269:         {Pid2,ok} -> ok
  270:     end.
  271: 
  272: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  273: connect2_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  274:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_socket, {bad, option}).
  275: 
  276: connect3_invalid_port(_Config) ->
  277:     {error, invalid_port} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, noport, [{key, value}]).
  278: 
  279: connect3_invalid_options(_Config) ->
  280:     {error, invalid_options} = ssh:connect(bogus_host, 1337, bad_options).
  281: 
  282: connect3_invalid_timeout_0(_Config) ->
  283:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  284:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], short).
  285: 
  286: connect3_invalid_timeout_1(_Config) ->
  287:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  288:         ssh:connect(bogus_socket, [{key, value}], -1).
  289: 
  290: connect3_invalid_both(_Config) ->
  291:     %% The actual reason is implementation dependent.
  292:     {error, _Reason} =
  293:         ssh:connect(bogus, no_list_or_port, no_list_or_timeout).
  294: 
  295: connect_invalid_port(Config) ->
  296:     {Pid, Host, _Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  297: 
  298:     {error, invalid_port} =
  299:         ssh:connect(Host, undefined,
  300:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  301:                      {user, "foo"},
  302:                      {password, "morot"},
  303:                      {user_interaction, false},
  304:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  305:                     infinity),
  306: 
  307:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  308: 
  309: connect_invalid_timeout_0(Config) ->
  310:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  311: 
  312:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  313:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  314:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  315:                      {user, "foo"},
  316:                      {password, "morot"},
  317:                      {user_interaction, false},
  318:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  319:                    longer),
  320: 
  321:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  322: 
  323: connect_invalid_timeout_1(Config) ->
  324:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  325: 
  326:     {error, invalid_timeout} =
  327:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  328:                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  329:                      {user, "foo"},
  330:                      {password, "morot"},
  331:                      {user_interaction, false},
  332:                      {user_dir, UserDir}],
  333:                    -1),
  334: 
  335:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  336: 
  337: connect_invalid_options(Config) ->
  338:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  339: 
  340:     {error, invalid_options} =
  341:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  342:                     {user, "foo"},
  343:                     infinity),
  344: 
  345:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  346: 
  347: %% Two out three arguments incorrect.  Three possibilities.
  348: connect4_invalid_two_0(Config) ->
  349:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  350: 
  351:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  352:     {error, _} =
  353:         ssh:connect(Host, noport,
  354:                     {user, "foo"},
  355:                     infinity),
  356: 
  357:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  358: 
  359: connect4_invalid_two_1(Config) ->
  360:     {Pid, Host, Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  361: 
  362:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  363:     {error, _} =
  364:         ssh:connect(Host, Port,
  365:                     {user, "foo"},
  366:                     short),
  367: 
  368:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  369: 
  370: connect4_invalid_two_2(Config) ->
  371:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  372: 
  373:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  374:     {error, _} =
  375:         ssh:connect(Host, newport,
  376:                     [{user, "foo"}],
  377:                     -1),
  378: 
  379:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  380: 
  381: %% All three args incorrect
  382: connect4_invalid_three(Config) ->
  383:     {Pid, Host, _Port, _UserDir} = daemon_start(Config),
  384: 
  385:     %% Actual error implementation dependent
  386:     {error, _} =
  387:         ssh:connect(Host, teleport,
  388:                     {user, "foo"},
  389:                     fortnight),
  390: 
  391:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  392: 
  393: daemon_start(Config) ->
  394:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  395:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  396:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  397:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  398: 
  399:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  400:                                              {user_dir, UserDir},
  401:                                              {password, "morot"},
  402:                                              {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
  403:     {Pid, Host, Port, UserDir}.
  404: 
  405: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  406: connect_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  407:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  408:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  409:                                                  {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  410:                                                  {user_interaction, true}]),
  411:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  412: 
  413: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  414: connect_timeout(_Config) ->
  415:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, []),
  416:     {ok, {_,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
  417:     {error,timeout} = ssh:connect(loopback, Port, [{connect_timeout,2000},
  418:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
  419:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true}]),
  420:     gen_tcp:close(Sl).
  421: 
  422: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  423: daemon_sock_not_tcp(_Config) ->
  424:     {ok,Sock} = gen_udp:open(0, []), 
  425:     {error, not_tcp_socket} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  426:     gen_udp:close(Sock).
  427: 
  428: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  429: connect_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  430:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  431:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{save_accepted_host, false},
  432:                                                    {silently_accept_hosts, true},
  433:                                                    {user_interaction, true}]),
  434:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  435: 
  436: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  437: daemon_sock_not_passive(_Config) ->
  438:     {ok,Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []), 
  439:     {error, not_passive_mode} = ssh:daemon(Sock),
  440:     gen_tcp:close(Sock).
  441: 
  442: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  443: small_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  444:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  445:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  446:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  447: 				  "cat", infinity),
  448: 
  449:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  450:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data),
  451:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  452: 
  453:     %% receive response to input
  454:     receive
  455: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, Data}} ->
  456: 	    ok
  457:     after 
  458: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  459:     end,
  460: 
  461:     %% receive close messages
  462:     receive
  463: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  464: 	    ok
  465:     after 
  466: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  467:     end,
  468:     receive
  469: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  470: 	    ok
  471:     after 
  472: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  473:     end,
  474:     receive
  475: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  476: 	    ok
  477:     after 
  478: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  479:     end.
  480: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  481: big_cat(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  482:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  483: 							     {user_interaction, false}]),
  484:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  485:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  486: 				  "cat", infinity),
  487: 
  488:     %% build 10MB binary
  489:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,2500000)>>,
  490: 
  491:     %% pre-adjust receive window so the other end doesn't block
  492:     ssh_connection:adjust_window(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, size(Data)),
  493: 
  494:     ct:log("sending ~p byte binary~n",[size(Data)]),
  495:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 10000),
  496:     ok = ssh_connection:send_eof(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0),
  497: 
  498:     %% collect echoed data until eof
  499:     case big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0) of
  500: 	{ok, Data} ->
  501: 	    ok;
  502: 	{ok, Other} ->
  503: 	    case size(Data) =:= size(Other) of
  504: 		true ->
  505: 		    ct:log("received and sent data are same"
  506: 			   "size but do not match~n",[]);
  507: 		false ->
  508: 		    ct:log("sent ~p but only received ~p~n",
  509: 			   [size(Data), size(Other)])
  510: 	    end,
  511: 	    ct:fail(receive_data_mismatch);
  512: 	Else ->
  513: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  514:     end,
  515: 
  516:     %% receive close messages (eof already consumed)
  517:     receive
  518: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
  519: 	    ok 
  520:     after 
  521: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  522:     end,
  523:     receive
  524: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  525: 	    ok
  526:     after 
  527: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  528:     end.
  529: 
  530: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  531: send_after_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  532:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  533:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  534:     Data = <<"I like spaghetti squash">>,
  535: 
  536:     %% Shell command "false" will exit immediately
  537:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
  538: 				  "false", infinity),
  539:     receive
  540: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
  541: 	    ok
  542:     after 
  543: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  544:     end,
  545:     receive
  546: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, ExitStatus}} when ExitStatus=/=0 ->
  547: 	    ok
  548:     after 
  549: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  550:     end,
  551:     receive
  552: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
  553: 	    ok
  554:     after 
  555: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
  556:     end,
  557:     case ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Data, 2000) of
  558: 	{error, closed} -> ok;
  559: 	ok ->
  560: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, ok}});
  561: 	{error, timeout} ->
  562: 	    ct:fail({expected,{error,closed}, {got, {error, timeout}}});
  563: 	Else ->
  564: 	    ct:fail(Else)
  565:     end.
  566: 
  567: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  568: encode_decode_pty_opts(_Config) ->
  569:     Tags =
  570:         [vintr, vquit, verase, vkill, veof, veol, veol2, vstart, vstop, vsusp, vdsusp,
  571:          vreprint, vwerase, vlnext, vflush, vswtch, vstatus, vdiscard, ignpar, parmrk,
  572:          inpck, istrip, inlcr, igncr, icrnl, iuclc, ixon, ixany, ixoff, imaxbel, isig,
  573:          icanon, xcase, echo, echoe, echok, echonl, noflsh, tostop, iexten, echoctl,
  574:          echoke, pendin, opost, olcuc, onlcr, ocrnl, onocr, onlret, cs7, cs8, parenb,
  575:          parodd, tty_op_ispeed, tty_op_ospeed],
  576:     Opts =
  577:         lists:zip(Tags,
  578:                   lists:seq(1, length(Tags))),
  579:     
  580:     case ssh_connection:encode_pty_opts(Opts) of
  581:         Bin when is_binary(Bin) ->
  582:             case ssh_connection:decode_pty_opts(Bin) of
  583:                 Opts ->
  584:                     ok;
  585:                 Other ->
  586:                     ct:log("Expected ~p~nGot ~p~nBin = ~p",[Opts,Other,Bin]),
  587:                     ct:fail("Not the same",[])
  588:             end;
  589:         Other ->
  590:             ct:log("encode -> ~p",[Other]),
  591:             ct:fail("Encode failed",[])
  592:     end.
  593: 
  594: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  595: ptty_alloc_default(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  596:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  597:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  598:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  599:                  true -> success;
  600:                  false -> failure
  601:              end,
  602:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []),
  603:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  604: 
  605: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  606: ptty_alloc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  607:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  608:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  609:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  610:                  true -> success;
  611:                  false -> failure
  612:              end,
  613:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  614:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {width, 70}, {height, 20}]),
  615:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  616: 
  617: 
  618: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  619: ptty_alloc_pixel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  620:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, []),
  621:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  622:     Expect = case proplists:get_value(ptty_supported, Config) of
  623:                  true -> success;
  624:                  false -> failure
  625:              end,
  626:     Expect = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, 
  627:                                        [{term, os:getenv("TERM", ?DEFAULT_TERMINAL)}, {pixel_widh, 630}, {pixel_hight, 470}]),
  628:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
  629: 
  630: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  631: small_interrupted_send(Config) -> 
  632:     K = 1024,
  633:     M = K*K,
  634:     do_interrupted_send(Config, 10*M, 4*K).
  635: interrupted_send(Config) ->
  636:     M = 1024*1024,
  637:     do_interrupted_send(Config, 10*M, 4*M).
  638: 
  639: do_interrupted_send(Config, SendSize, EchoSize) ->
  640:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  641:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  642:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  643:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  644:     EchoSS_spec = {ssh_echo_server, [EchoSize,[{dbg,true}]]},
  645:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  646: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  647: 					     {password, "morot"},
  648: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n",EchoSS_spec}]}]),
  649:     
  650:     ct:log("~p:~p connect", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  651:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  652: 						      {user, "foo"},
  653: 						      {password, "morot"},
  654: 						      {user_interaction, false},
  655: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  656:     ct:log("~p:~p connected", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  657: 
  658:     %% build big binary
  659:     Data = << <<X:32>> || X <- lists:seq(1,SendSize div 4)>>,
  660: 
  661:     %% expect remote end to send us EchoSize back
  662:     <<ExpectedData:EchoSize/binary, _/binary>> = Data,
  663: 
  664:     %% Spawn listener. Otherwise we could get a deadlock due to filled buffers
  665:     Parent = self(),
  666:     ResultPid = spawn(
  667: 		  fun() ->
  668: 			  ct:log("~p:~p open channel",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  669: 			  {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
  670: 			  ct:log("~p:~p start subsystem", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  671: 			  case ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "echo_n", infinity) of
  672: 			      success ->
  673: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, ChannelId},
  674: 				  
  675: 				  Result = 
  676: 				      try collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize)
  677: 				      of
  678: 					  ExpectedData -> 
  679: 					      ct:log("~p:~p got expected data",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  680: 					      ok;
  681: 					  Other ->
  682: 					      ct:log("~p:~p unexpected: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  683: 					      {fail,"unexpected result in listener"}
  684: 				      catch
  685: 					  Class:Exception ->
  686: 					      {fail, io_lib:format("Listener exception ~p:~p",[Class,Exception])}
  687: 				      end,
  688: 				  Parent ! {self(), result, Result};
  689: 			      Other ->
  690: 				  Parent ! {self(), channelId, error, Other}
  691: 			  end
  692: 		  end),
  693:     
  694:     receive
  695: 	{ResultPid, channelId, error, Other} ->
  696: 	    ct:log("~p:~p channelId error ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other]),
  697: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  698: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  699: 	    {fail, "ssh_connection:subsystem"};
  700: 
  701: 	{ResultPid, channelId, ChannelId} ->
  702: 	    ct:log("~p:~p ~p going to send ~p bytes", [?MODULE,?LINE,self(),size(Data)]),
  703: 	    SenderPid = spawn(fun() ->
  704: 				      Parent ! {self(),  ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Data, 30000)}
  705: 			      end),
  706: 	    receive
  707: 	    	{ResultPid, result, {fail, Fail}} ->
  708: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Listener failed: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Fail]),
  709: 		    {fail, Fail};
  710: 
  711: 		{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  712: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  713: 		    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  714: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  715: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Check sender", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
  716: 		    receive
  717: 			{SenderPid, {error, closed}} ->
  718: 			    ct:log("~p:~p {error,closed} - That's what we expect :)",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  719: 			    ok;
  720: 			Msg ->
  721: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Not expected send result: ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  722: 			    {fail, "Not expected msg"}
  723: 		    end;
  724: 
  725: 		{SenderPid, {error, closed}} ->
  726: 		    ct:log("~p:~p {error,closed} - That's what we expect, but client channel handler has not reported yet",[?MODULE,?LINE]),
  727: 		    receive
  728: 			{ResultPid, result, Result} ->
  729: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Now got the result: ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Result]),
  730: 			    ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  731: 			    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
  732: 			    ok;
  733: 			Msg ->
  734: 			    ct:log("~p:~p Got an unexpected msg ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  735: 			    {fail, "Un-expected msg"}
  736: 		    end;
  737: 
  738: 		Msg ->
  739: 		    ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
  740: 		    {fail, "Unexpected msg"}
  741: 	    end
  742:     end.
  743: 
  744: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
  745: start_shell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  746:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  747:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  748:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  749:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  750:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  751: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  752: 					     {password, "morot"},
  753: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
  754: 
  755:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  756: 						      {user, "foo"},
  757: 						      {password, "morot"},
  758: 						      {user_interaction, true},
  759: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  760:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Enter command">>), % No pty alloc by erl client
  761:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),
  762:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  763:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  764: 
  765: %%-------------------------------------------------------------------

  769:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  770:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  771:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  772: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  773: 					     {password, "morot"},
  774: 					     {shell, fun(U, H) -> start_our_shell(U, H) end} ]),
  775: 
  776:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  777: 						      {user, "foo"},
  778: 						      {password, "morot"},
  779: 						      {user_interaction, true},
  780: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  781:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Enter command\r\n">>, [{pty_opts,[{onlcr,1}]}]), % alloc pty 
  782:     test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef),
  783:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
  784:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).

  894: start_shell_exec_fun(Config) ->
  895:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd) ->
  896:                                     spawn(fun() ->
  897:                                                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
  898:                                           end)
  899:                             end,
  900:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
  901:                             Config).
  902: 
  903: start_shell_exec_fun2(Config) ->
  904:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User) ->
  905:                                     spawn(fun() ->
  906:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
  907:                                           end)
  908:                             end,
  909:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\n">>, 0,
  910:                             Config).
  911: 
  912: start_shell_exec_fun3(Config) ->
  913:     do_start_shell_exec_fun(fun(Cmd, User, _PeerAddr) ->
  914:                                     spawn(fun() ->
  915:                                                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
  916:                                           end)
  917:                             end,
  918:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing\n">>, 0,
  919:                             Config).
  920: 
  921: start_shell_exec_direct_fun(Config) ->
  922:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s~n",[Cmd])} end},
  923:                             "testing", <<"echo testing\n">>, 0,
  924:                             Config).
  925: 
  926: start_shell_exec_direct_fun2(Config) ->
  927:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
  928:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
  929:                             Config).
  930:

  932:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(Cmd,User,_PeerAddr) -> {ok, io_lib:format("echo ~s ~s",[User,Cmd])} end},
  933:                             "testing", <<"echo foo testing">>, 0,
  934:                             Config).
  935: 
  936: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error(Config) ->
  937:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> {error, {bad}} end},
  938:                             "testing", <<"**Error** {bad}">>, 1,
  939:                             Config).
  940: 
  941: start_shell_exec_direct_fun1_error_type(Config) ->
  942:     do_start_shell_exec_fun({direct, fun(_Cmd) -> very_bad end},
  943:                             "testing", <<"**Error** Bad exec fun in server. Invalid return value: very_bad">>, 1,
  944:                             Config).
  945: 
  946: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write(Config) ->
  947:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  948:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  949:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  950:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  951:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
  952: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
  953: 					     {password, "morot"},
  954: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
  955: 
  956:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
  957:                                           {user, "foo"},
  958:                                           {password, "morot"},
  959:                                           {user_interaction, true},
  960:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
  961: 
  962:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
  963: 
  964:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
  965:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\n">>}}),
  966: 
  967:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
  968:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
  969:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\n">>}}),
  970: 
  971:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
  972:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "quit.\n", 5000),
  973:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{1,inputs}">>}}),
  974:     receive
  975:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,0}} -> ok
  976:     after 5000 -> go_on
  977:     end,
  978:     receive
  979:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
  980:     after 5000 -> go_on
  981:     end,
  982:     receive
  983:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
  984:     after 5000 -> go_on
  985:     end,
  986:     receive
  987:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
  988:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
  989:     after 0 -> go_on
  990:     end,
  991:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
  992: 
  993: 
  994: start_exec_direct_fun1_read_write_advanced(Config) ->
  995:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  996:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
  997:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
  998:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  999:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1000: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1001: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1002: 					     {exec, {direct,fun read_write_loop/1}}]),
 1003: 
 1004:     C = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1005:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1006:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1007:                                           {user_interaction, true},
 1008:                                           {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1009: 
 1010:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 1011: 
 1012:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, "> ", infinity),
 1013:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"Tiny read/write test\n">>}}),
 1014: 
 1015:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"1> ">>}}),
 1016:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "hej.\n", 5000),
 1017:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,hej}\n">>}}),
 1018: 
 1019:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"2> ">>}}),
 1020:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'Hi ", 5000),
 1021:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "there", 5000),
 1022:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "'", 5000),
 1023:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, ".\n", 5000),
 1024:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"{simple_eval,'Hi there'}\n">>}}),
 1025:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,0,<<"3> ">>}}),
 1026:     ok = ssh_connection:send(C, Ch, "bad_input.\n", 5000),
 1027:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result_or_fail({ssh_cm,C,{data,Ch,1,<<"**Error** {bad_input,3}">>}}),
 1028:     receive
 1029:         {ssh_cm,C,{exit_status,Ch,255}} -> ok
 1030:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1031:     end,
 1032:     receive
 1033:         {ssh_cm,C,{eof,Ch}} -> ok
 1034:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1035:     end,
 1036:     receive
 1037:         {ssh_cm,C,{closed,Ch}} -> ok
 1038:     after 5000 -> go_on
 1039:     end,
 1040:     receive
 1041:         X -> ct:fail("remaining messages"),
 1042:              ct:log("remaining message: ~p",[X])
 1043:     after 0 -> go_on
 1044:     end,
 1045:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1046: 
 1047: 
 1048: 
 1049:     
 1050: %% A tiny read-write loop ended by a 'quit.\n'
 1051: read_write_loop(Prompt) ->
 1052:     io:format("Tiny read/write test~n", []),
 1053:     read_write_loop1(Prompt, 1).
 1054: 
 1055: read_write_loop1(Prompt, N) ->
 1056:     case io:read(lists:concat([N,Prompt])) of
 1057:         {ok, quit} ->
 1058:             {ok, {N-1, inputs}};
 1059:         {ok, bad_input} ->
 1060:             {error, {bad_input,N}};
 1061:         {ok,Inp} ->
 1062:             io:format("~p~n",[simple_eval(Inp)]),
 1063:             read_write_loop1(Prompt, N+1)
 1064:     end.
 1065:     
 1066: simple_eval(Inp) -> {simple_eval,Inp}.
 1067: 
 1068: 
 1069: do_start_shell_exec_fun(Fun, Command, Expect, ExpectType, Config) ->
 1070:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1071:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1072:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1073:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1074:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1075: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1076: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1077: 					     {exec, Fun}]),
 1078: 
 1079:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1080: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1081: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1082: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1083: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1084: 
 1085:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1086: 
 1087:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, Command, infinity),
 1088: 
 1089:     receive
 1090: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, ExpectType, Expect}} ->
 1091: 	    ok
 1092:     after 5000 ->
 1093:             receive
 1094:                 Other ->
 1095:                     ct:log("Received other:~n~p~nExpected: ~p~n",
 1096:                            [Other, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, '_ChannelId', ExpectType, Expect}} ]),
 1097:                     ct:fail("Unexpected response")
 1098:             after 0 ->
 1099:                     ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1100:             end
 1101:     end,
 1102: 
 1103:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1104:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1105: 
 1106: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1107: start_shell_sock_exec_fun(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1108:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1109:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1110:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1111:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1112:     {Pid, HostD, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1113:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1114:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1115:                                               {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1116:     Host = ssh_test_lib:ntoa(ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(HostD)),
 1117: 
 1118:     {ok, Sock} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, [{active,false}]),
 1119:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sock, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1120:                                             {save_accepted_host, false},
 1121: 					    {user, "foo"},
 1122: 					    {password, "morot"},
 1123: 					    {user_interaction, true},
 1124: 					    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1125: 
 1126:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1127: 
 1128:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1129: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1130: 
 1131:     receive
 1132: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1133: 	    ok
 1134:     after 5000 ->
 1135: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1136:     end,
 1137: 
 1138:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1139:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1140: 
 1141: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1142: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec(Config) ->
 1143:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1144:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1145:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1146:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1147: 
 1148:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1149:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1150:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1151: 
 1152:     %% A server tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1153:     spawn_link(fun() ->
 1154: 		       {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1155: 		       {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1156: 						    {user_dir, UserDir},
 1157: 						    {password, "morot"},
 1158: 						    {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}])
 1159: 	       end),
 1160: 
 1161:     %% The client accepts the tcp connection from the server and ssh-connects to it
 1162:     {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1163:     {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1164:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1165: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1166: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1167: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1168: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1169: 
 1170:     %% And runs some commands
 1171:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1172: 
 1173:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1174: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1175: 
 1176:     receive
 1177: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1178: 	    ok
 1179:     after 5000 ->
 1180: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1181:     end,
 1182: 
 1183:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef).
 1184: 
 1185: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1186: start_shell_sock_daemon_exec_multi(Config) ->
 1187:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1188:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1189:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1190:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1191: 
 1192:     NumConcurent = 5,
 1193: 
 1194:     %% Listening tcp socket at the client side
 1195:     {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0, [{active,false}]),
 1196:     {ok,{_IP,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),	% _IP is likely to be {0,0,0,0}. Win don't like...
 1197: 
 1198:     DaemonOpts = [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1199:                   {user_dir, UserDir},
 1200:                   {password, "morot"},
 1201:                   {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}],
 1202: 
 1203:     %% Servers tcp-contects to the listening socket and starts an ssh daemon
 1204:     Pids =
 1205:         [spawn_link(fun() ->
 1206:                             {ok,Ss} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Port, [{active,false}]),
 1207:                             {ok, _Pid} = ssh:daemon(Ss, DaemonOpts)
 1208:                     end)
 1209:          || _ <- lists:seq(1,NumConcurent)],
 1210:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p daemons spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(Pids)]),
 1211: 
 1212:     %% The client accepts the tcp connections from the servers and ssh-connects to it
 1213:     ConnectionRefs =
 1214:         [begin
 1215:              {ok,Sc} = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1216:              {ok,ConnectionRef} = ssh:connect(Sc, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1217:                                                    {save_accepted_host, false},
 1218:                                                    {user, "foo"},
 1219:                                                    {password, "morot"},
 1220:                                                    {user_interaction, true},
 1221:                                                    {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1222:              ConnectionRef
 1223:          end || _Pid <- Pids],
 1224:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p connections accepted!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ConnectionRefs)]),
 1225: 
 1226:     %% And runs some exec commands
 1227:     Parent = self(),
 1228:     ClientPids =
 1229:         lists:map(
 1230:           fun(ConnectionRef) ->
 1231:                   spawn_link(
 1232:                     fun() ->
 1233:                             {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1234:                             success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "testing", infinity),
 1235:                             ct:log("~p:~p: exec on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef]),
 1236:                             receive
 1237:                                 {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, _ChannelId, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1238:                                     Parent ! {answer_received,self()},
 1239:                                     ct:log("~p:~p: received result on connection ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,ConnectionRef])
 1240:                             after 5000 ->
 1241:                                     ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1242:                             end
 1243:                     end)
 1244:           end, ConnectionRefs),
 1245:     ct:log("~p:~p: ~p clients spawned!", [?MODULE,?LINE,length(ClientPids)]),
 1246: 
 1247:     lists:foreach(fun(P) ->
 1248:                           receive
 1249:                               {answer_received,P} -> ok
 1250:                           end
 1251:                   end, ClientPids),
 1252:     ct:log("~p:~p: All answers received!", [?MODULE,?LINE]),
 1253: 
 1254:     lists:foreach(fun ssh:close/1, ConnectionRefs).
 1255: 
 1256: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1257: gracefull_invalid_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1258:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1259:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1260:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1261:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1262:     
 1263:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1264:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1265:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1266: 
 1267:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1268:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["SSH-8.-1","\r\n"]),
 1269:     receive
 1270: 	Verstring ->
 1271: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1272: 	    receive
 1273: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1274: 		    ok
 1275: 	    end
 1276:     after 
 1277: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1278:     end.
 1279: 
 1280: gracefull_invalid_start(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1281:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1282:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1283:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1284:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1285:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1286:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1287:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1288: 
 1289:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1290:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S,  ["foobar","\r\n"]),
 1291:     receive
 1292: 	Verstring ->
 1293: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1294: 	    receive
 1295: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1296: 		    ok
 1297: 	    end
 1298:     after 
 1299: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1300:     end.
 1301:

 1305:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1306:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1307:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1308:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1309:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1310: 
 1311:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1312:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S, [lists:duplicate(257, $a), "\r\n"]),
 1313:     receive
 1314: 	Verstring ->
 1315: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),

 1318: 		    ok
 1319: 	    end

 1321: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])

 1325: gracefull_invalid_long_start_no_nl(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1326:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1327:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1328:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1329:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1330:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1331:                                                {user_dir, UserDir},
 1332:                                                {password, "morot"}]),
 1333: 
 1334:     {ok, S} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1335:     ok = gen_tcp:send(S, [lists:duplicate(257, $a), "\r\n"]),
 1336:     receive
 1337: 	Verstring ->
 1338: 	    ct:log("Server version: ~p~n", [Verstring]),
 1339: 	    receive
 1340: 		{tcp_closed, S} ->
 1341: 		    ok
 1342: 	    end

 1346: 
 1347: kex_error(Config) ->
 1348:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1349:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1350:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1351:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1352:     [Kex1,Kex2|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, ssh:default_algorithms()),
 1353:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1354:                                               {user_dir, UserDir},
 1355:                                               {password, "morot"},
 1356:                                               {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex1]}]}
 1357:                                              ]),
 1358:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1359:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(kex_error,
 1360:                            fun(#{msg:={report,#{format:=Fmt,args:=As,label:={error_logger,_}}}}, Pid) ->
 1361:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1362:                                    Pid ! {Ref, lists:flatten(io_lib:format(Fmt,As))};
 1363:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1364:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1365:                                    ok % Other msg
 1366:                            end,
 1367:                            self()),
 1368:     try
 1369:         ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1370:                                           {user, "foo"},
 1371:                                           {password, "morot"},
 1372:                                           {user_interaction, false},
 1373:                                           {user_dir, UserDir},
 1374:                                           {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[Kex2]}]}
 1375:                                          ])
 1376:     of
 1377:         _ ->
 1378:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1379:             ct:fail("expected failure", [])
 1380:     catch
 1381:         error:{badmatch,{error,"Key exchange failed"}} ->
 1382:             %% ok
 1383:             receive
 1384:                 {Ref, ErrMsgTxt} ->
 1385:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1386:                     ct:log("ErrMsgTxt = ~n~s", [ErrMsgTxt]),
 1387:                     Lines = lists:map(fun string:trim/1, string:tokens(ErrMsgTxt, "\n")),
 1388:                     OK = (lists:all(fun(S) -> lists:member(S,Lines) end,
 1389:                                     ["Disconnects with code = 3 [RFC4253 11.1]: Key exchange failed",
 1390:                                      "Details:",
 1391:                                      "No common key exchange algorithm,",
 1392:                                      "we have:",
 1393:                                      "peer have:"]) andalso
 1394:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex1)) =/= nomatch andalso
 1395:                           string:find(ErrMsgTxt, atom_to_list(Kex2)) =/= nomatch),
 1396:                     case OK of
 1397:                         true ->
 1398:                             ok;
 1399:                         false ->
 1400:                             ct:fail("unexpected error text msg", [])
 1401:                     end
 1402:             after 20000 ->
 1403:                     ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1404:                     ct:fail("timeout", [])
 1405:             end;
 1406: 
 1407:         error:{badmatch,{error,_}} ->
 1408:             ok = logger:remove_handler(kex_error),
 1409:             ct:fail("unexpected error msg", [])
 1410:     end.
 1411: 
 1412: stop_listener(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1413:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1414:     %% to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1415:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey),
 1416:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1417:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1418: 
 1419:     {Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1420: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1421: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1422: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1423: 
 1424:     ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port,
 1425:                                           [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1426:                                            {user, "foo"},
 1427:                                            {password, "morot"},
 1428:                                            {user_interaction, false},
 1429:                                            {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1430:     {ok, ChannelId0} =
 1431:         ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef0, infinity),
 1432: 
 1433:     ssh:stop_listener(Host, Port),
 1434: 
 1435:     {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1436:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1437:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1438: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1439: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1440: 					  {user_interaction, true},
 1441: 					  {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1442:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef0, ChannelId0,
 1443: 				  "testing", infinity),
 1444:     receive
 1445: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef0,
 1446:          {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"echo testing\n">>}} ->
 1447: 	    ok
 1448:     after 5000 ->
 1449: 	    ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1450:     end,
 1451: 
 1452:     case ssh_test_lib:daemon(Port, [{system_dir, SysDir},
 1453:                                     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1454:                                     {password, "potatis"},
 1455:                                     {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]) of
 1456: 	{Pid1, Host, Port} ->
 1457: 	    ConnectionRef1 =
 1458:                 ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1459:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1460:                                                   {password, "potatis"},
 1461:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1462:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1463: 	    {error, _} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1464:                                                   {save_accepted_host, false},
 1465:                                                   {user, "foo"},
 1466:                                                   {password, "morot"},
 1467:                                                   {user_interaction, true},
 1468:                                                   {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1469: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1470: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef1),
 1471: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1472: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid1);
 1473: 	Error ->
 1474: 	    ssh:close(ConnectionRef0),
 1475: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid0),
 1476: 	    ct:fail({unexpected, Error})
 1477:     end.
 1478: 
 1479: no_sensitive_leak(Config) ->
 1480:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1481:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1482:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1483:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1484: 
 1485:     %% Save old, and set new log level:
 1486:     #{level := Level} = logger:get_primary_config(),
 1487:     logger:set_primary_config(level, info),
 1488:     %% Define a collect fun:
 1489:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1490:     Collect = 
 1491:         fun G(N,Nf,Nt) ->
 1492:                 receive
 1493:                     {Ref, false, _} ->
 1494:                         G(N+1, Nf+1, Nt);
 1495:                     {Ref, true, R} ->
 1496:                         ct:log("Report leaked:~n~p", [R]),
 1497:                         G(N+1, Nf, Nt+1)
 1498:                 after 100 ->
 1499:                         {N, Nf, Nt}
 1500:                 end
 1501:         end,
 1502:  
 1503:     %% Install the test handler:
 1504:     Hname = no_sensitive_leak,
 1505:     ok = ssh_log_h:add_fun(Hname,
 1506:                            fun(#{msg := {report,#{report := Rep}}}, Pid) ->
 1507:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1508:                                    Pid ! {Ref,ssh_log_h:sensitive_in_opt(Rep),Rep};
 1509:                               (_,Pid) ->
 1510:                                    true = (erlang:process_info(Pid, status) =/= undefined), % remove handler if we are dead
 1511:                                    ok
 1512:                            end,
 1513:                            self()),
 1514: 
 1515:     {_Pid0, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1516: 					      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1517: 					      {password, "morot"},
 1518: 					      {exec, fun ssh_exec_echo/1}]),
 1519: 
 1520:     _ConnectionRef0 = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1521: 						       {user, "foo"},
 1522: 						       {password, "morot"},
 1523: 						       {user_interaction, true},
 1524: 						       {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1525:     %% Kill acceptor to make it restart:
 1526:     [true|_] =
 1527:         [exit(Pacc,kill) || {{ssh_system_sup,_},P1,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(sshd_sup),
 1528:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},P2,supervisor,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P1),
 1529:                             {{ssh_acceptor_sup,_},Pacc,worker,_} <- supervisor:which_children(P2)],
 1530:     
 1531:     %% Remove the test handler and reset the logger level:
 1532:     timer:sleep(500),
 1533:     logger:remove_handler(Hname),
 1534:     logger:set_primary_config(Level),
 1535: 
 1536:     case Collect(0, 0, 0) of
 1537:         {0, 0,   0} -> ct:fail("Logging failed, line = ~p", [?LINE]);
 1538:         {_, _,   0} -> ok;
 1539:         {_, _, Nt0} -> ct:fail("Leak in ~p cases!", [Nt0])
 1540:     end.
 1541:     
 1542: start_subsystem_on_closed_channel(Config) ->
 1543:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1544:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1545:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1546:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1547:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1548: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1549: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1550: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}]),
 1551: 
 1552:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1553: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1554: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1555: 						      {user_interaction, false},
 1556: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1557: 
 1558: 
 1559:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1560:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1),
 1561:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, []),
 1562:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", 5000),
 1563:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1564:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1565: 
 1566:     %% Test that there could be a gap between close and an operation (Bugfix OTP-14939):
 1567:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1568:     ok = ssh_connection:close(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2),
 1569:     timer:sleep(2000),
 1570:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, []),
 1571:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "echo_n", 5000),
 1572:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", 5000),
 1573:     {error, closed} = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1574: 
 1575:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1576:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1577: 
 1578: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1579: max_channels_option(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1580:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1581:     UserDir = filename:join(PrivDir, nopubkey), % to make sure we don't use public-key-auth
 1582:     file:make_dir(UserDir),
 1583:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1584:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1585: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1586: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1587: 					     {max_channels, 3},
 1588: 					     {subsystems, [{"echo_n", {ssh_echo_server, [4000000]}}]}
 1589: 					    ]),
 1590: 
 1591:     ConnectionRef = ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1592: 						      {user, "foo"},
 1593: 						      {password, "morot"},
 1594: 						      {user_interaction, true},
 1595: 						      {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1596: 
 1597:     %% Allocate a number of ChannelId:s to play with. (This operation is not
 1598:     %% counted by the max_channel option).
 1599:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1600:     {ok, ChannelId1} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1601:     {ok, ChannelId2} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1602:     {ok, ChannelId3} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1603:     {ok, ChannelId4} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1604:     {ok, ChannelId5} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1605:     {ok, ChannelId6} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1606:     {ok, _ChannelId7} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1607: 
 1608:     %% Now start to open the channels (this is counted my max_channels) to check that
 1609:     %% it gives a failure at right place
 1610: 
 1611:     %%%---- Channel 1(3): shell
 1612:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId0),
 1613:     receive
 1614: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"Eshell",_/binary>>}} ->
 1615: 	    ok
 1616:     after 5000 ->
 1617: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1618:     end,
 1619: 
 1620:     %%%---- Channel 2(3): subsystem "echo_n"
 1621:     success = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId1, "echo_n", infinity),
 1622: 
 1623:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): exec. This closes itself.
 1624:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId2, "testing1.\n", infinity),
 1625:     receive
 1626: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId2, 0, <<"testing1",_/binary>>}} ->
 1627: 	    ok
 1628:     after 5000 ->
 1629: 	    ct:fail("Exec #1 Timeout")
 1630:     end,
 1631: 
 1632:     %%%---- Channel 3(3): subsystem "echo_n" (Note that ChannelId2 should be closed now)
 1633:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId3, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1634: 
 1635:     %%%---- Channel 4(3) !: exec  This should fail
 1636:     failure = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId4, "testing2.\n", infinity),
 1637: 
 1638:     %%%---- close the shell (Frees one channel)
 1639:     ok = ssh_connection:send(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0, "exit().\n", 5000),
 1640:     
 1641:     %%%---- wait for the subsystem to terminate
 1642:     receive
 1643: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef,{closed,ChannelId0}} -> ok
 1644:     after 5000 ->
 1645: 	    ct:log("Timeout waiting for '{ssh_cm,~p,{closed,~p}}'~n"
 1646: 		   "Message queue:~n~p",
 1647: 		   [ConnectionRef,ChannelId0,erlang:process_info(self(),messages)]),
 1648: 	    ct:fail("exit Timeout",[])
 1649:     end,
 1650: 
 1651:     %%---- Try that we can open one channel instead of the closed one
 1652:     ?wait_match(success, ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId5, "echo_n", infinity)),
 1653: 
 1654:     %%---- But not a fourth one...
 1655:     failure = ssh_connection:subsystem(ConnectionRef, ChannelId6, "echo_n", infinity),
 1656: 
 1657:     ssh:close(ConnectionRef),
 1658:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1659: 
 1660: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1661: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 1662: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1663: 
 1664: do_simple_exec(ConnectionRef) ->
 1665:     {ok, ChannelId0} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1666:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId0,
 1667: 				  "echo testing", infinity),
 1668:     %% receive response to input
 1669:     receive
 1670: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId0, 0, <<"testing\n">>}} ->
 1671: 	    ok
 1672:     after
 1673: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1674:     end,
 1675: 
 1676:     %% receive close messages
 1677:     receive
 1678: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId0}} ->
 1679: 	    ok
 1680:     after
 1681: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1682:     end,
 1683:     receive
 1684: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {exit_status, ChannelId0, 0}} ->
 1685: 	    ok
 1686:     after
 1687: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1688:     end,
 1689:     receive
 1690: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef,{closed, ChannelId0}} ->
 1691: 	    ok
 1692:     after
 1693: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1694:     end.
 1695: 
 1696: 
 1697: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1698: flush_msgs() ->
 1699:     receive
 1700:         _ -> flush_msgs()
 1701:     after
 1702:         500 -> ok
 1703:     end.
 1704: 
 1705: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1706: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1707:     test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Prohibited.">>, <<"Eshell V">>).
 1708: 
 1709: test_shell_is_disabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, NotExpect) ->
 1710:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1711:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef, ChannelId),
 1712:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1713:     NotExpSz = size(NotExpect),
 1714:     receive
 1715:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 1, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1716:             flush_msgs();
 1717: 
 1718:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<NotExpect:NotExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1719:             ct:fail("Could start disabled shell!");
 1720: 
 1721:         R ->
 1722:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1723:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, '0|1', Expect}} ]),
 1724:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 1725: 
 1726:     after 5000 ->
 1727:             ct:fail("Shell Timeout")
 1728:     end.
 1729: 
 1730: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1731: test_exec_is_disabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1732:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1733:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, "1+2.", infinity),
 1734:     receive
 1735:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ->
 1736:             flush_msgs();
 1737:         R ->
 1738:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1739:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data,ChannelId,1,<<"Prohibited.">>}} ]),
 1740:             ct:fail("Could exec erlang term although non-erlang shell")
 1741:     after 5000 ->
 1742:             ct:fail("Exec Timeout")
 1743:     end.
 1744: 
 1745: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1746: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1747:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, <<"Eshell V">>).
 1748: 
 1749: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect) ->
 1750:     test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, []).
 1751: 
 1752: test_shell_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Expect, PtyOpts) ->
 1753:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1754:     case PtyOpts of
 1755:         [] ->
 1756:             no_alloc;
 1757:         _ ->
 1758:             success = ssh_connection:ptty_alloc(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, PtyOpts)
 1759:     end,
 1760:     ok = ssh_connection:shell(ConnectionRef,ChannelId),
 1761: 
 1762:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1763:     receive
 1764: 	{ssh_cm,ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} ->
 1765: 	    flush_msgs();
 1766: 
 1767:         R ->
 1768:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1769:                    [?MODULE,?LINE,R, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ]),
 1770:             ct:fail("Strange shell response")
 1771: 
 1772:     after 5000 ->
 1773: 	    ct:fail("CLI Timeout")
 1774:     end.
 1775: 
 1776: 
 1777: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef) ->
 1778:     test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, "1+2.", <<"3">>).
 1779: 
 1780: test_exec_is_enabled(ConnectionRef, Exec, Expect) ->
 1781:     {ok, ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(ConnectionRef, infinity),
 1782:     success = ssh_connection:exec(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Exec, infinity),
 1783:     ExpSz = size(Expect),
 1784:     receive
 1785:         {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, <<Expect:ExpSz/binary, _/binary>>}} = R ->
 1786:             ct:log("~p:~p Got expected ~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,R]);
 1787:         Other ->
 1788:             ct:log("~p:~p Got unexpected ~p~nExpect: ~p~n",
 1789:                    [?MODULE,?LINE, Other, {ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Expect}} ])
 1790:     after 5000 ->
 1791:             {fail,"Exec Timeout"}
 1792:     end.
 1793: 
 1794: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1795: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId) ->
 1796:     big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, []).
 1797: 
 1798: big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, Acc) ->
 1799:     receive
 1800: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} ->
 1801: 	    %% ssh_connection:adjust_window(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, size(Data)),
 1802: 	    %% window was pre-adjusted, don't adjust again here
 1803: 	    big_cat_rx(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, [Data | Acc]);
 1804: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {eof, ChannelId}} ->
 1805: 	    {ok, iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))}
 1806:     after ?EXEC_TIMEOUT ->
 1807: 	    timeout
 1808:     end.
 1809: 
 1810: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize) ->
 1811:     ct:log("~p:~p Listener ~p running! ConnectionRef=~p, ChannelId=~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,self(),ConnectionRef,ChannelId]),
 1812:     collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [], 0).
 1813: 
 1814: collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum) ->
 1815:     TO = 5000,
 1816:     receive
 1817: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, {data, ChannelId, 0, Data}} when is_binary(Data) ->
 1818: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p bytes. total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 1819: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,size(Data),Sum+size(Data),EchoSize-Sum]),
 1820: 	    ssh_connection:adjust_window(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, size(Data)),
 1821: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, [Data | Acc], Sum+size(Data));
 1822: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={eof, ChannelId}} ->
 1823: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 1824: 
 1825: 	{ssh_cm, ConnectionRef, Msg={closed,ChannelId}} ->
 1826: 	    collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize);
 1827: 
 1828: 	Msg ->
 1829: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ***** unexpected message *****~n~p",[?MODULE,?LINE,Msg]),
 1830: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 1831: 
 1832:     after TO ->
 1833: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: ----- Nothing received for ~p seconds -----~n",[?MODULE,?LINE,TO]),
 1834: 	    collect_data(ConnectionRef, ChannelId, EchoSize, Acc, Sum)
 1835:     end.
 1836: 
 1837: collect_data_report_end(Acc, Msg, EchoSize) ->
 1838:     try
 1839: 	iolist_to_binary(lists:reverse(Acc))
 1840:     of
 1841: 	Bin ->
 1842: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nGot in total ~p bytes,  want ~p more",
 1843: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,size(Bin),EchoSize,size(Bin)]),
 1844: 	    Bin
 1845:     catch
 1846: 	C:E ->
 1847: 	    ct:log("~p:~p collect_data: received ~p.~nAcc is strange...~nException=~p:~p~nAcc=~p",
 1848: 		   [?MODULE,?LINE,Msg,C,E,Acc]),
 1849: 	    {error,{C,E}}
 1850:     end.
 1851: 
 1852: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
 1853: %% This is taken from the ssh example code.
 1854: start_our_shell(_User, _Peer) ->
 1855:     spawn(fun() ->
 1856: 		  io:format("Enter command\n")
 1857: 		  %% Don't actually loop, just exit
 1858:           end).
 1859: 
 1860: 
 1861: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd) ->
 1862:     spawn(fun() ->
 1863:                   io:format("echo ~s\n", [Cmd])
 1864:           end).
 1865: 
 1866: ssh_exec_echo(Cmd, User) ->
 1867:     spawn(fun() ->
 1868:                   io:format("echo ~s ~s\n",[User,Cmd])
 1869:           end).
